In NUnit/.NET land we had test FixtureSetup/FixtureTearDown (run once for
e=
ach test fixture, not once a test case) in addition to regular setUp and
te=
arDown. I've tended to use these methods when I want to do something
expens=
ive (File I/O etc.). While I know I should avoid expensive operations
in my=
 test cases sometimes they are very useful. So is there are a standard
idio=
m for doing fixture setup? Do I resort to statics?

BTW I know and like Ced=
ric's TestNG =96 however our organisation is sold on

making enough waves on the process front.
